topic.title: HPE Helion Development Platform 2.0: Installation Overview

section.p: These instructions are for installing the HPE Helion Development Platform on an HPE Helion OpenStack deployment. The instructions for installing on an HPE Helion CloudSystem deployment are different.
The HPE Helion Development Platform is made up of several services. Each of these services can be installed independently. You do not have to install them in any particular order.
Services are installed using the HDP Installer, also known as HDPI. This tool is a plugin for the python-openstackclient (OSC). You must download and set up the HDPI before installing any services.

During installation, the HDPI refers to a configuration file named clouds.yaml for the parameters it needs. There is only one clouds.yaml file, which you will create at ~/.config/openstack/clouds.yaml. Each section within that file contains parameters required to install a service. Since each service can be installed separately, you can populate the whole file at once, or only one section at a time, as you prefer, as long as the information is present before you attempt installation.

During installation, the required files will be downloaded from the Helion Download Network (HDN). Depending on network traffic, this may take up to 90 minutes for a single package. Direct download may not be possible if your HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager (previously known as the deployer node), is behind significant layers of security. To avoid possible delay, interruption, or just for convenience, you can download the files to portable storage media before beginning the installation process. If the installer finds the files already in the appropriate location, it will not download them again.

section.title: General Installation Procedure
section.p: You do not have to install all available services at the same time.

ol.li: (optional) Download the installation files from the Helion Download Network (HDN) and, if necessary, copy them to the correct location.
Ensure all prerequisites are satisfied: check the environmental configuration, gather required information, and verify required connectivity.
Download and set up the HDPI. During this process, you will create and minimally populate the clouds.yaml file.
Populate the clouds.yaml file with the information required for the next service you intend to install.

Using the HDPI, install a service.
Application Lifecycle Service
Database Service
Messaging Broker Service
HPE Helion Code Engine
Repeat steps 4 and 5 until you have completed your installation.
